column2: Venezuelans Vote Early in Referendum on Chavez Rule (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Venezuelans turned out early\and in large numbers on Sunday to vote in a historic referendum\that will either remove left-wing President Hugo Chavez from\office or give him a new mandate to govern for the next two\years.

column2: S.Koreans Clash with Police on Iraq Troop Dispatch (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - South Korean police used water cannon in\central Seoul Sunday to disperse at least 7,000 protesters\urging the government to reverse a controversial decision to\send more troops to Iraq.

column2: Palestinians in Israeli Jails Start Hunger Strike (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Thousands of Palestinian\prisoners in Israeli jails began a hunger strike for better\conditions Sunday, but Israel's security minister said he\didn't care if they starved to death.

column2: Seven Georgian soldiers wounded as South Ossetia ceasefire violated (AFP)
column3: AFP - Sporadic gunfire and shelling took place overnight in the disputed Georgian region of South Ossetia in violation of a fragile ceasefire, wounding seven Georgian servicemen.

column2: Rwandan Troops Arrive in Darfur (AP)
column3: AP - Dozens of Rwandan soldiers flew into Sudan's troubled Darfur region Sunday, the first foreign armed force deployed in the area since Arab militiamen began a rampage against black African farmers, killing thousands.

column2: Rwanda Troops Airlifted to Start AU Mission in Darfur (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Rwandan troops were airlifted on Sunday\to Sudan's Darfur as the first foreign force there, mandated to\protect observers monitoring a cease-fire between the Sudanese\government and rebels in the troubled western region.

column2: Australian FM to visit North Korea for talks on nuclear crisis (AFP)
column3: AFP - Australia's foreign minister will pay a rare visit to North Korea this week for talks on its nuclear programme after creating a stir here by warning a North Korean missile would be able to hit Sydney.

column2: Kerry Campaign Helping With Fla. Recovery (AP)
column3: AP - Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry does not plan to visit Florida in the aftermath of Hurricane Charley because he's concerned his campaign entourage could distract from recovery efforts, he said Saturday.

column2: Edwards Calls for Changes to Drug Plans (AP)
column3: AP - Democratic vice presidential candidate John Edwards called for changes to prescription drug programs and praised running mate John Kerry's military and government service at an outdoor campaign rally here Saturday.

column2: Kerry leading Bush in key swing states (AFP)
column3: AFP - Although polls show the US presidential race a virtual dead heat, Democrat John Kerry appears to be gaining an edge over George W. Bush among the key states that could decide the outcome.

column2: Democratic Senator Urges Energy Reform (AP)
column3: AP - Congress must pass legislation to protect the nation's electricity grid if it wants to avoid repeats of the devastating outages that rolled across eight states last year, Sen. Maria Cantwell, D-Wash., said Saturday.

column2: Missouri Attorney General Sues EPA (AP)
column3: AP - Missouri's attorney general sued the federal environmental agency on Friday, saying it is behind on testing the state's air for lead as required by law.

column2: Mortars Mark Opening of Iraqi Political Conference
column3: BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Insurgents fired mortars at a meeting  where Iraqi leaders met to pick an interim national assembly  Sunday, killing at least two people in a grim reminder of the  country's tortured path toward democracy.

column2: Japan Ministers Pay Homage at Shrine for War Dead
column3: TOKYO (Reuters) - Three Japanese ministers paid homage at a  controversial shrine for war dead Sunday, the 59th anniversary  of Japan's World War II surrender, a move that drew anger from  Asian neighbors.

column2: Najaf battle a crucial test for Allawi
column3: Clashes between US troops and Sadr militiamen escalated Thursday, as the US surrounded Najaf for possible siege.

column2: Who are Ch #225;vez's opponents?
column3: On Sunday, Venezuelans will decide whether to cut short the president's term, which is due to end in 2006.

column2: Phelps, Thorpe Advance in 200 Freestyle (AP)
column3: AP - Michael Phelps took care of qualifying for the Olympic 200-meter freestyle semifinals Sunday, and then found out he had been added to the American team for the evening's 400 freestyle relay final. Phelps' rivals Ian Thorpe and Pieter van den Hoogenband and teammate Klete Keller were faster than the teenager in the 200 free preliminaries.

column2: Reds Knock Padres Out of Wild-Card Lead (AP)
column3: AP - Wily Mo Pena homered twice and drove in four runs, helping the Cincinnati Reds beat the San Diego Padres 11-5 on Saturday night. San Diego was knocked out of a share of the NL wild-card lead with the loss and Chicago's victory over Los Angeles earlier in the day.

column2: Dreaming done, NBA stars awaken to harsh Olympic reality (AFP)
column3: AFP - National Basketball Association players trying to win a fourth consecutive Olympic gold medal for the United States have gotten the wake-up call that the "Dream Team" days are done even if supporters have not.

column2: Indians Beat Twins 7-1, Nearing AL Lead (AP)
column3: AP - The Cleveland Indians pulled within one game of the AL Central lead, scoring four runs in the first inning and beating the Minnesota Twins 7-1 Saturday night behind home runs by Travis Hafner and Victor Martinez.

column2: Galaxy, Crew Play to 0-0 Tie (AP)
column3: AP - Kevin Hartman made seven saves for Los Angeles, and Jon Busch had two saves for Columbus as the Galaxy and Crew played to a 0-0 tie Saturday night.

column2: USC Begins Season Where It Ended, at No. 1 (AP)
column3: AP - Southern California will begin defense of its first national title in 31 years as the No. 1 team in the nation. The Trojans earned the top spot in the preseason Associated Press poll released Saturday by receiving 48 of 65 first-place votes and 1,603 points.

column2: Tough Race Ahead for Swimmer Phelps
column3: ATHENS (Reuters) - Michael Phelps, his first gold medal  safely gathered in, eased through the next phase of his  monumental Olympic challenge in the heats of the 200 meters  freestyle Sunday but the immensity of the task ahead was clear.

column2: Iranian Will Not Meet Israeli in Olympics Due to Weight
column3: ATHENS (Reuters) - A diplomatic wrangle of Olympic  proportions was avoided Sunday when Iranian world judo champion  Arash Miresmaeili failed to make the weight for his clash with  an Israeli opponent.

column2: Tiger Runs Out of Steam After Storming Start
column3: KOHLER, Wisconsin (Reuters) - Tiger Woods failed to make  the most of a red-hot start in the U.S. PGA Championship third  round on Saturday, having to settle for a three-under-par 69.

column2: Colander Misses Chance to Emulate Jones
column3: ATHENS (Reuters) - But for a decision that enraged her  coach, LaTasha Colander might have been the Marion Jones of the  Athens Olympics.

column2: AL Wrap: Olerud Cheers Yankees by Sinking Ex-Team
column3: NEW YORK (Reuters) - John Olerud sunk his former team by  recording a two-run single in the eighth inning to drive in the  go-ahead runs which earned the New York Yankees a 6-4 win over  the host Seattle Mariners in the American League Saturday.

column2: NL Wrap: Jones Homers Twice as Braves Down Cards
column3: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Chipper Jones cracked two homers and  Julio Franco's two-run double in the seventh inning drove in  the winning runs as the streaking Atlanta Braves downed the St.  Louis Cardinals 9-7 in the National League Saturday.

column2: Olympics-Doping-Greek Media Put Country's Honor Above Athletes
column3: ATHENS (Reuters) - The honor of Greece lies above  individual athletes and no backstage antics should compromise  it, Greek media said Sunday, after the country's top athletes  were suspended from the team under a cloud of doping suspicion.

column2: Olympics-Rowing-U.S. Eight Beats Canada to Set World Best Time
column3: ATHENS (Reuters) - The United States beat Canada in a world  best time to qualify for the final of the men's Olympic eights  race Sunday, as the two crews renewed their fierce rivalry in  front of a raucous crowd at Schinias.

column2: Singh Leads, but Leonard Is Following
column3: Avoiding the late trouble that knocked other contenders off track, Vijay Singh held a one-stroke lead over Justin Leonard heading into the final round of the P.G.A. Championship.

column2: Olerud Bails Out Loaiza in His Latest Bungled Audition
column3: John Olerud reveled in his return to Safeco Field by slapping a two-run single that lifted the Yankees and saved Esteban Loaiza from a defeat.

column2: Wall St. Bears Claw Back Into the Black (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Short-sellers, Wall Street's dwindling\band of ultra-cynics, are seeing green again.

column2: Carlyle Looks Toward Commercial Aerospace (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Private investment firm Carlyle Group,\which has a reputation for making well-timed and occasionally\controversial plays in the defense industry, has quietly placed\its bets on another part of the market.

column2: Oil and Economy Cloud Stocks' Outlook (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Soaring crude prices plus worries\about the economy and the outlook for earnings are expected to\hang over the stock market next week during the depth of the\summer doldrums.

column2: Iraq Halts Oil Exports from Main Southern Pipeline (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Authorities have halted oil export\flows from the main pipeline in southern Iraq after\intelligence showed a rebel militia could strike\infrastructure, an oil official said on Saturday.

column2: Oil prices soar to all-time record, posing new menace to US economy (AFP)
column3: AFP - Tearaway world oil prices, toppling records and straining wallets, present a new economic menace barely three months before the US presidential elections.

column2: Stocks End Up, But Near Year Lows (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Stocks ended slightly higher on Friday\but stayed near lows for the year as oil prices surged past  #36;46\a barrel, offsetting a positive outlook from computer maker\Dell Inc. (DELL.O)

column2: Fed minutes show dissent over inflation (USATODAY.com)
column3: USATODAY.com - Retail sales bounced back a bit in July, and new claims for jobless benefits fell last week, the government said Thursday, indicating the economy is improving from a midsummer slump.

column2: Safety Net (Forbes.com)
column3: Forbes.com - After earning a PH.D. in Sociology, Danny Bazil Riley started to work as the general manager at a commercial real estate firm at an annual base salary of  #36;70,000. Soon after, a financial planner stopped by his desk to drop off brochures about insurance benefits available through his employer. But, at 32, "buying insurance was the furthest thing from my mind," says Riley.

column2: Wall St. Bears Claw Back Into the Black
column3: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Short-sellers, Wall Street's dwindling  band of ultra-cynics, are seeing green again.

column2: Oil and Economy Cloud Stocks' Outlook
column3: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Soaring crude prices plus worries  about the economy and the outlook for earnings are expected to  hang over the stock market next week during the depth of the  summer doldrums.

column2: No Need for OPEC to Pump More-Iran Gov
column3: TEHRAN (Reuters) - OPEC can do nothing to douse scorching  oil prices when markets are already oversupplied by 2.8 million  barrels per day (bpd) of crude, Iran's OPEC governor said  Saturday, warning that prices could fall sharply.

column2: Non-OPEC Nations Should Up Output-Purnomo
column3: JAKARTA (Reuters) - Non-OPEC oil exporters should consider  increasing output to cool record crude prices, OPEC President  Purnomo Yusgiantoro said on Sunday.

column2: Google IPO Auction Off to Rocky Start
column3: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK (Reuters) - The auction for Google  Inc.'s highly anticipated initial public offering got off to a  rocky start on Friday after the Web search company sidestepped  a bullet from U.S. securities regulators.

column2: Dollar Falls Broadly on Record Trade Gap
column3: NEW YORK (Reuters) - The dollar tumbled broadly on Friday  after data showing a record U.S. trade deficit in June cast  fresh doubts on the economy's recovery and its ability to draw  foreign capital to fund the growing gap.

column2: Rescuing an Old Saver
column3: If you think you may need to help your elderly relatives with their finances, don't be shy about having the money talk -- soon.

column2: Kids Rule for Back-to-School
column3: The purchasing power of kids is a big part of why the back-to-school season has become such a huge marketing phenomenon.

column2: 'Madden,' 'ESPN' Football Score in Different Ways (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Was absenteeism a little high\on Tuesday among the guys at the office? EA Sports would like\to think it was because "Madden NFL 2005" came out that day,\and some fans of the football simulation are rabid enough to\take a sick day to play it.

column2: Group to Propose New High-Speed Wireless Format (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - A group of technology companies\including Texas Instruments Inc. (TXN.N), STMicroelectronics\(STM.PA) and Broadcom Corp. (BRCM.O), on Thursday said they\will propose a new wireless networking standard up to 10 times\the speed of the current generation.

column2: AOL to Sell Cheap PCs to Minorities and Seniors (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - America Online on Thursday said it\plans to sell a low-priced PC targeting low-income and minority\households who agree to sign up for a year of dialup Internet\service.

column2: Companies Approve New High-Capacity Disc Format (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - A group of consumer electronics\makers said on Wednesday they approved the format for a new\generation of discs that can store five times the data of DVDs\at the same cost -- enough to put a full season of "The\Sopranos" on one disc.

column2: Missing June Deals Slow to Return for Software Cos. (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - The mystery of what went wrong for the\software industry in late June when sales stalled at more than\20 brand-name companies is not even close to being solved\although the third quarter is nearly halfway over.

column2: Hacker Cracks Apple's Streaming Technology (AP)
column3: AP - The Norwegian hacker famed for developing DVD encryption-cracking software has apparently struck again  #151; this time breaking the locks on Apple Computer Inc.'s wireless music streaming technology.

column2: Open Source Apps Developer SugarCRM Releases Sugar.Sales 1.1 (TechWeb)
column3: TechWeb - News - August 13, 2004

column2: Oracle Sales Data Seen Being Released (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Oracle Corp. sales documents\detailing highly confidential information, such as which\companies receive discounts on Oracle's business software\products and the size of the discounts, are likely to be made\public, a federal judge said on Friday.

column2: Sun's Looking Glass Provides 3D View (PC World)
column3: PC World - Developers get early code for new operating system 'skin' still being crafted.

column2: Apple to open second Japanese retail store this month (MacCentral)
column3: MacCentral - Apple Computer Inc. will open its second Japanese retail store later this month in the western Japanese city of Osaka, it said Thursday.

column2: Charley's Force Took Experts by Surprise (AP)
column3: AP - Hurricane Charley's 145-mph force took forecasters by surprise and showed just how shaky a science it still is to predict a storm's intensity  #151; even with all the latest satellite and radar technology.

column2: Science, Politics Collide in Election Year (AP)
column3: AP - With more than 4,000 scientists, including 48 Nobel Prize winners, having signed a statement opposing the Bush administration's use of scientific advice, this election year is seeing a new development in the uneasy relationship between science and politics.

column2: Building Dedicated to Columbia Astronauts (AP)
column3: AP - A former dormitory converted to classrooms at the Pensacola Naval Air Station was dedicated Friday to two Columbia astronauts who were among the seven who died in the shuttle disaster Feb. 1, 2003.

column2: Russian Cargo Craft Docks at Space Station (AP)
column3: AP - A Russian cargo ship docked with the international space station Saturday, bringing food, water, fuel and other items to the two-man Russian-American crew, a space official said.

column2: Bangkok's Canals Losing to Urban Sprawl (AP)
column3: AP - Along the banks of the canal, women in rowboats grill fish and sell fresh bananas. Families eat on floating pavilions, rocked gently by waves from passing boats.

column2: T. Rex Had Teen Growth Spurt, Scientists Say (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Tyrannosaurus Rex grew incredibly fast\during a teenaged growth spurt that saw the dinosaur expand its\bulk by six times, but the fearsome beasts "lived fast and died\young," researchers said on Wednesday.
